H0.text: Mechanical energy to electrical energy is the energy conversion provided by the generators that a hospital may rely on after a storm to power some equipment.

H1.text: Thermal energy to mechanical energy is the energy conversion provided by the backup generators that a hospital may rely on after a storm to power some equipment.

H2.text: Nuclear energy to mechanical energy is the energy conversion performed by the backup generators that a hospital may rely on after a storm to power some equipment.

H3.text: Thermal energy to electrical energy is the energy conversion provided by the backup generators that a hospital may rely on to power some equipment after a storm.

A4.text: A generator, also called an electric generator, electrical generator, and electromagnetic generator is an electromechanical device that converts mechanical energy to electrical energy for use in an external circuit.

A5.text: Most power stations in the world burn fossil fuels such as coal, oil, and natural gas to generate electricity.
